definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate

sentences.english: I love this early morning, I love this Prague only scarcely dotted with visitors. On the Charles Bridges, pigeons are the only visitors looking for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我爱这清晨，这游人尚还稀少的布拉格。

sentences.english: Guys shouldn't give flowers too often or too infrequently.
sentences.chinese: 男士送花不应该太频繁或太稀少。

sentences.english: European bond markets continued to creak as buyers remained scarce.
sentences.chinese: 由于买家稀少，欧洲债券市场仍处于勉力维持的境地。

sentences.english: The survivors of the bowmen, the warriors of Kedar, will be few.
sentences.chinese: 弓箭手所余剩的，就是基达人的勇士，必然稀少。

sentences.english: Those vibrations result in the compression and rarefaction of the surrounding air.
sentences.chinese: 这些振动会导致周遭空气被压缩及稀少。

sentences.english: "The tea leaves that are falling—as sparse as they are—are falling on the negative side, " said Jim Meyer, chief investment officer at Tower Bridge Advisors.
sentences.chinese: 正如茶叶本身的稀少的一样，茶叶正下跌为负数。

sentences.english: Now the city was large and great: but the people were few therein, and the houses were not builded.
sentences.chinese: 城是广大，其中的民却稀少，房屋还没有建造。

sentences.english: Most ofthe fibers in the neuropil are unmyelinated, and myelinated fibers are scarce.
sentences.chinese: 神经毡内无髓纤维最多，有髓纤维稀少。

sentences.english: Toward the suburb the houses begin to thin out.
sentences.chinese: 靠近市郊的地方房屋渐渐稀少。

sentences.english: The method is straightforward, it is applicable to design precipitation station for those regions where precipitation station is spare.
sentences.chinese: 该法简单，适用于雨量站稀少地区的雨量站网规划。

sentences.english: Kalahari: The Great Thirstland Long spells of sparse rains leave riverbeds dry, and little to eat.
sentences.chinese: 稀少雨水的长期循环造成河床干枯，食物非常少。

sentences.english: Namibia is one of the most sparsely populated countries in the world.
sentences.chinese: 纳米比亚是世界上人口最稀少的国家之一。

sentences.english: Scarcity of deer in some areas of Texas is attributed to the screw-worm.
sentences.chinese: 得可萨斯州某些地区鹿群稀少可归因于这种螺旋锥蝇。

sentences.english: Or exiguous not neat, color is dim.
One possible reason for the rapid drift was a lack of ice, she suggested.
sentences.chinese: 她表示，漂移迅速的一个可能原因是冰量稀少。

sentences.english: And his opposite person seemed to be also to feel that the Yin breeze thins out gradually.
sentences.chinese: 而他对面的人似乎也感觉到了阴风逐渐变得稀少。

definition: rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
the rarer sth is, the greater its value (idiom)
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
